snippet: Marrakesh is already well-anchored as an exotic winter getaway for Europeans, Americans and well-heeled Moroccans. But in this city of medieval souks and alleyways, not to mention palatial out-of-town villas, a larger ambition blooms. Some residents,...
abstract: Marrakesh is already well-anchored as an exotic winter getaway for Europeans, Americans and well-heeled Moroccans. But in this city of medieval souks and alleyways, not to mention palatial out-of-town villas, a larger ambition blooms. Some residents, native and non-native, want the city to become a genuine art destination, one that does not just rely on the past. In the past few years, it has dipped its toes in a few contemporary art fairs and film festivals that were charitably called ''unexceptional.'' But things could change this time with the Arts in Marrakech Biennale that is running for five days, through March 4.

headline.main: Biennale Amid the Souks and the Arab Spring
